historySnippet.action: Updated Params: k_A_decay, k_AU, k_AC, k_U
historySnippet.reasoning: Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt=0.0044), so to take a calculated risk for richer emergent behavior without collapsing diversity (D≈0.98, k_DU=0), I’ll run a mild “challenge phase” by increasing U while keeping decay low and stimulation high (historically, lowering k_A_decay improved A at Gen 3619.1).

A is already >0.75 and still rising, but D has started to drift down, so I’ll run a mild “challenge” step by nudging U toward the best-record regime while slightly reducing D’s intrinsic decay to prevent a diversity crash (since recent k_D_decay tweaks often hurt A).

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt>0), while Diversity is starting to collapse (dD/dt<0), so I’ll revert U toward the best-record setting (0.10) and slightly reduce diversity decay to stabilize D without sacrificing A (noting prior k_A_decay tweaks were beneficial but we’ll avoid more volatility).

Agency is already well above the 0.75 threshold and still rising; since the best record occurred at U=0.10 and recent tweaks to k_D_decay/k_A_decay caused mixed or negative swings, hold U at the proven optimum and avoid destabilizing parameter changes while A consolidates near 1.0.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 threshold and still rising while D is only slightly declining; since best performance occurred at U=0.10 and recent mixed parameter tweaks sometimes hurt A, keep U at the proven setting and make a small stabilizing reduction to k_A_decay (which previously improved A) without adding diversity pressure.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt>0), so I’ll take a calculated “challenge” step by increasing U while keeping diversity pressure minimal (k_DU=0) and slightly reducing A decay to preserve the high-A regime given recent mixed sensitivity to decay tweaks.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising; since the best record occurred at U=0.10 and recent avg U is higher (0.12) with slight instability in A after tweaks, revert U toward the best while keeping the current strong agency-driving params to stabilize and potentially push A closer to 1.0.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt=+0.0035) while complexity is slightly decaying, so I’ll keep U at the best-record value (0.10) and make a small stabilizing tweak to reduce C decay without disrupting the proven high-A regime.

Agency is already well above 0.75 and still rising (dA/dt>0) while C and D are slightly decaying, so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) and counter the negative dC/dt and dD/dt by minimally reducing k_C_decay and k_D_decay to stabilize the substrate without perturbing the high-A regime seen near the best record.

A is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt=0.0040) while D is starting to slip, so keep U at the proven best (0.10) and make a small stabilizing nudge to prevent diversity collapse without disrupting the high-agency regime seen near the best-record params.

name: Divergence-Locked Agency Weaver
description: This agent crossed the threshold by tightly coupling agency to both complexity and environmental difficulty (k_AC=0.5, k_AU=1, k_U=0.35) while keeping its internal state exceptionally low-noise (sigma_A=0.005, sigma_C=0.005), allowing small parameter gains to compound into reliable control. Its lineage shows agency sensitivity to tuning: early boosts came from strengthening the agency pathways (k_AU/k_AC/k_U) and later recovery required careful reduction of agency decay (k_A_decay=0.001) after a difficulty shift to U=0.10 temporarily knocked performance down; it ultimately stabilized by maintaining maximal diversity (D=1.0) with slow diversity loss (k_D_decay=0.001) despite several destabilizing decay/growth adjustments.
